node.title: Defending champs England into World Cup final
node.description: Danni Wyatt scored her second one-day international century and Sophie Ecclestone took six wickets as champions England cruised into the World Cup final.

node.title: Record number of cranes in use around the motu
node.description: The booming construction sector has led to a record number of big cranes in use with demand expected to stay high.

node.title: Porsche and Audi under starters orders for F1
node.description: Audi and Porsche owner Volkswagen is set to give the green light for the two brands to make their entry into Formula One.

node.title: 'Great feedback': Half-price fares for public transport from today
node.description: Commuters around the country are gearing up to make the most of half-price fares on public transport from today.

node.title: 162,000 pounds of Skippy recalled due to metal fragments
node.description: Jars of Hormel Foods brand sold by major retailers may contain pieces of steel from manufacturing equipment.

node.title: Appetite grows on Capitol Hill for code of conduct for Supreme Court justices
node.description: "If your wife is an admitted and proud contributor to a coup of our country, maybe you should weigh that in your ethical standards," House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said Thursday.

node.title: All Whites one game away from World Cup
node.description: The All Whites are another step closer to the World Cup after winning the Oceania qualifying tournament.

node.title: Federal judge strikes down part of new Florida election law
node.description: A federal judge ruled some of the law's provisions were enacted "with the intent to discriminate against Black voters."

node.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (April 3)
node.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the #1 Sunday morning news program

node.title: Social Security to allow people to self-select their sex
node.description: The agency is "committed to reducing barriers and ensuring the fair treatment of the LGBTQ+ community," an official said.

node.title: MƒÅori remain 'scared' despite shift on uplift of children - lawyer
node.description: The uplift of children from their families increased on average in the four months after the minister in charge ordered a step change. However, the overall trend is steeply down.

node.title: Here's who may still be eligible for stimulus checks
node.description: Some Americans may still be waiting for their third federal stimulus check, according to the Treasury Department.

node.title: Corporate America hasn't been this profitable since 1950
node.description: Major corporations are largely shrugging off inflation on their way to record profits, government data shows.

node.title: Student shot at South Carolina middle school, suspect in custody
node.description: A suspect is in custody.

node.title: Will Smith refused to leave Oscars, academy says
node.description: Will Smith refused a request to leave the Oscars ceremony after he slapped presenter Chris Rock, says Hollywood's film academy.

node.title: Top UK judges resign from Hong Kong's highest court
node.description: The judges say China's new national security law has made their role on the highest court untenable.

node.title: Parents of Trevor Reed, jailed in Russia, protest at the White House
node.description: President Biden met Wednesday with Joey and Paula Reed, whose son was sentenced last year to nine years in prison in Russia.

node.description: Known for his work in NgƒÅi Tahu's Treaty Settlement and dedication to building an inclusive, bicultural nation - TƒÅ Tipene O'Regan has been named the 2022 New Zealander of the Year.

node.title: Man discovers "alien" creature's corpse washed up on Australian beach
node.description: He said it had "humanlike hands, long lizard tail, nose like a possum and patches of black fur."

node.title: Over 50 House Republicans attend fundraiser for Liz Cheney's challenger
node.description: House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy headlined the fundraiser for Harriet Hageman, Cheney's challenger in Wyoming.

node.title: Biden says Putin appears to be "self-isolated"
node.description: But, Mr. Biden added, "I don't want to put too much stock in that at this time because we don't have that much hard evidence."

node.title: 'Best in history': The nail-biting Cricket World Cup
node.description: The Detail - The White Ferns may not have made it into the final four, but the 2022 Cricket World Cup is being hailed as a success for the women's game.

node.title: FEC fines Clinton campaign, DNC; clears "Steele dossier" author of wrongdoing
node.description: Federal Election Commission said the campaign mislabeled Christopher Steele's opposition work as "legal services" and "legal and compliance consulting"

node.title: Trans health care is a "matter of life or death," doctors say
node.description: Lawmakers are focused on the future of trans health care, but doctors say the proposed bills are hurting their patients now.

node.title: Scientists finish decoding entire human genome in major breakthrough
node.description: The research caps off decades of work to better understand human evolution and biology.

node.title: What is the Strategic Petroleum Reserve?
node.description: Previous moves to tap the nation's oil stockpile haven't dramatically lowered gas prices, research shows.

node.title: New Zealanders pitch in to help injured in Ukraine war
node.description: An ambulance emblazoned with a New Zealand flag is assisting the war-wounded on the streets of Kyiv. Audio

node.title: Air NZ secures good credit rating before capital raising
node.description: Air New Zealand has achieved early one of the key aims of its $2.2 billion capital boost - maintaining its investment grade credit rating.

node.title: Pike River mine site being handed to Dept of Conservation
node.description: The land will become a part of Paparoa National Park, more than 12 years after the disaster that claimed the lives of 29 men.

node.title: Celebrities and friends react to Bruce Willis diagnosis
node.description: Comedian Rachel Dratch said Willis was the first celebrity she's ever met and he "couldn't have been sweeter to us wannabes."
